radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated measuring 12 mm in diameter with associated mucosal hyperenhancement, adjacent fat stranding, and mesenteric free fluid. Associated inflammatory changes of the terminal ileum and cecum are noted. The visualized lung fields are within normal limits, and no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, urinary bladder, and reproductive organs are all within normal limits.
